TEXT: The applicant , a national of GPE and GPE , was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . The respondent Government are represented by Mr PERSON , Agent . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE criminal proceedings on charges of fraud and other offences were initiated against the applicant and CARDINAL other suspects . On DATE the applicant was arrested . On DATE the ORG ordered his detention on remand . This decision was upheld on appeal .

After extensions of his detention on DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE , the applicant was released on DATE . He alleges that between that date and DATE he stayed at his mother ’s home in GPE , GPE .
On DATE the case - file was transferred to the public prosecutor ’s office .
On DATE a bill of indictment was preferred in the case . The applicant was charged with the offences of fraud and forgery and manipulation of documents .
On DATE the Pest Central District Court ’s mail to the applicant , which included the bill of indictment , was returned as the addressee was unknown .
On DATE ORG confirmed that the applicant could not be located at his last known address .
Having received information about the applicant ’s last address before his emigration to GPE , in DATE ORG unsuccessfully attempted to serve the bill of indictment on him at that address .
On DATE ORG in GPE issued a passport to the applicant . According to the stamps in this passport , during the period until DATE the applicant travelled to and from GPE on numerous occasions .
On DATE ORG informed ORG that the search for the applicant had been unsuccessful . On DATE an arrest warrant was issued .
A hearing was held on DATE . Observing that some defendants had absconded , ORG suspended the proceedings . Subsequently , the case was transferred to the Budapest II / III District Court .

On DATE the applicant lodged an application for a passport with ORG in GPE . On DATE ORG refused to renew his NORP passport on account of the criminal proceedings pending against him . On DATE the Minister of the ORG dismissed his administrative appeal .

Subsequently , ORG was informed of these administrative proceedings . Using the address indicated by the applicant in his passport application , the court again attempted to serve the bill of indictment on him , but without success . In response to the court ’s request , the competent ORG found out about the applicant ’s address in Csömör on DATE .
Meanwhile , apparently on DATE , the applicant left GPE and returned to GPE where he has remained ever since .

On DATE a summons to a hearing scheduled for DATE was served on the applicant ’s wife . At the hearing , however , neither the applicant nor his formerly authorised legal counsel showed up . On DATE the counsel informed ORG that he was no longer representing the applicant . The court ’s renewed summons could not be served on the applicant as he was not available at his last known address .
The next hearing was held on DATE .

The applicant ’s whereabouts remained unknown until DATE when he wrote to ORG from GPE . On DATE ORG again issued an arrest warrant . Its further attempts to summon the applicant using his last known addresses in GPE and GPE GPE remained unsuccessful .
Another hearing took place on DATE . On this occasion , the court considered the possibility of seeking the applicant ’s extradition .
On DATE ORG again suspended the proceedings , having regard to the fact that the applicant and other defendants had absconded .

On DATE ORG resumed the proceedings . It held a hearing on DATE and another hearing on DATE . On DATE , it issued an order discontinuing the criminal proceedings against the applicant on the ground that the charges had become time - barred on DATE .

According to section QUANTITY of LAW , as in force in the relevant period , a period of suspension is included in the prescription period if the proceedings are suspended because the perpetrator ’s whereabouts are unknown .
